definition: to express/to give expression to/variant of 紓|纾[shu1]/to relieve
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: From then on, many medical schools and various classics on medicine were brought into being in succession, each having its own strong points.
sentences.chinese: 自此許多不同的學派及經典著作相繼出現，各抒己見。

sentences.english: Sound off3. Should people be fined for illegally downloading music?
sentences.chinese: 非法下載歌曲該被罰款嗎？來各抒己見吧。

sentences.english: The research group brainstormed the problem all day.
sentences.chinese: 研究小組就此問題整天開展各抒己見的自由討論。

sentences.english: What a series of questions of setting up etc. to air one's own views.
sentences.chinese: 如何設置等一系列問題各抒己見。

sentences.english: Hope that we can express their opinions together to improve our position.
sentences.chinese: 希望大家能各抒己見，共同提高我們的陣地。

sentences.english: I think it would have been better if you had given us more of a chance to give out opinions.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得如果你要是給我們機會各抒己見就更好了。
